answers.answer: It's Polycystic ovarian syndrome.What are the symptoms of Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS)?These are some of the symptoms of PCOS:infrequent menstrual periods, no menstrual periods, and/or irregular bleedinginfertility or inability to get pregnant because of not ovulatingincreased growth of hair on the face, chest, stomach, back, thumbs, or toesacne, oily skin, or dandruffpelvic painweight gain or obesity, usually carrying extra weight around the waisttype 2 diabeteshigh cholesterolhigh blood pressuremale-pattern baldness or thinning hairpatches of thickened and dark brown or black skin on the neck, arms, breasts, or thighsskin tags, or tiny excess flaps of skin in the armpits or neck areasleep apnea

question: Does having POS mean you have many cysts on your ovary or can you have a single large cyst? Also what are some warning signs you may Have POS? I have been having cysts since  was 11 years old and i am now 24. I am on brth control and i stll seem to get cysts. My peroids have been irregular in the past 6 months. When i do miss a perod i get all the sympyoms lke back pain and sever cramps but no peroid. Currently i have one cyst on my right ovary that started off being 6.5 cm and after 7 months it is now 1.5cm. I asked my ob/gyn what it could be but she did not say anything much... said somethng on the lines of "maybe your just a cyst maker?" what the hell is that? I had a CT scan and i have a appointment on Monday to get the results. I just want to be able to walk in the office knowing what im talking about. If anyone could give me some insight that would be great!
title: POS
